body:
Comment 3: 
This is not the right place for this discussion; followups to golang-nuts, please.

A struct inherits all methods of any anonymous field, including those of an interface
field.  The spec says that "fields and methods" of an anonymous field are promoted to be
fields and methods of the struct.  There is no exception for anonymous fields of
interface type.

I actually also don't think this is a LanguageChange, I think it's just a bug in 6g. 
gccgo prints "Object.f" twice as expected.
